News.Title: Jai Corp Opens SEBI Special Window for Physical Securities
News.Summary: Jai Corp Limited announces SEBI's special window for transfer and dematerialisation of physical securities sold/purchased before April 01, 2019, open until February 04, 2027.

News.Title: Jai Corp Board Meet Set for Feb 13 to Review Q3 Results
News.Summary: Jai Corp Limited has scheduled a board meeting on February 13, 2026, to consider and approve unaudited standalone and consolidated financial results for Q3FY26 ended December 31, 2025.

News.Title: Jai Corp Subsidiary Jaicorp Welfare Struck Off
News.Summary: Jai Corp Limited announces that its wholly-owned subsidiary Jaicorp Welfare Limited has been officially struck off from the Register of Companies by the Ministry of Corporate Affairs on January 27, 2026.

News.Title: ED Seizes ₹17.4M Cash, Freezes ₹990M Assets from Jai Corp
News.Summary: Enforcement Directorate takes ₹17.40 million in cash from two Jai Corp directors and freezes ₹990 million in demat accounts and mutual funds. Financial impact on company remains unclear.

News.Title: JaiCorp reveals ED froze ₹99cr assets, seized ₹1.74cr cash
News.Summary: JaiCorp Limited discloses ED froze ₹99 crores worth assets of subsidiary UIVCL and seized ₹1.74 crores cash from directors' residences following December 19 searches.

News.Title: Jai Corp Limited Pays Rs. 2.06 Lakh Fine for Board Composition and Committee Constitution Violations
News.Summary: Jai Corp Limited paid a fine of Rs. 2,06,500 to BSE Limited for non-compliance with board composition requirements including failure to appoint a woman director and issues with nomination and remuneration committee constitution for the quarter ended September 30, 2025. The violations were related to delay in appointment of an Independent Director, with the company settling the penalty on November 28, 2025.

News.Title: JaiCorp Limited Approves Subsidiary Closure and Board Committee Changes
News.Summary: JaiCorp Limited's Board approved the closure and liquidation of wholly-owned subsidiary Jaicorp Welfare Limited due to lack of economic activity, aimed at streamlining group structure and reducing compliance costs. The Board also appointed Mr. Amit Kumar Mundra as an independent director to multiple committees including Audit, CSR, and Business Responsibility and Sustainability Committees effective November 23, 2025.

News.Title: JaiCorp Limited Board Addresses Stock Exchange Fines for Governance Non-Compliance
News.Summary: JaiCorp Limited's Board discussed fines imposed by BSE and NSE for non-compliance with board composition requirements, including failure to appoint a woman director and improper constitution of nomination and remuneration committee. The Board expressed regret over delays in finding suitable independent director candidates and emphasized the need for enhanced compliance measures, with fines already paid on 2 September 2025.

News.Title: Jai Corp Reports Strong Net Profit Growth Despite EBITDA Margin Decline in Q1
News.Summary: Jai Corp reported consolidated net profit of 1.04 billion rupees in Q1, significantly higher than 137 million rupees in the same period last year. Revenue increased to 1.3 billion rupees from 1.2 billion rupees year-over-year. However, EBITDA declined to 82 million rupees from 136 million rupees, with EBITDA margin dropping to 6.27% from 11.26% in the previous year. The company recorded other income of 1.03 billion rupees during the quarter.

News.Title: Jai Corp Limited Appoints Independent Director and Declares Dividends
News.Summary: Jai Corp Limited appointed Mr. Amit K. Mundra as an additional non-executive independent director for a five-year term starting July 26, 2025, subject to shareholder approval. Mundra is a Fellow Member of the Institute of Chartered Accountants of India with over 23 years of experience in corporate finance, system audit, and bank audit. The company also declared a special interim dividend of Rs. 5.00 per share for FY 2025-26 on 17,55,04,995 fully paid-up equity shares, with a record date of August 1, 2025. Additionally, the board recommended a final dividend of Re. 0.50 per share for FY 2024-25 on the same number of shares.

News.Title: Jai Corp Limited Declares Special Interim Dividend of Rs. 5 Per Share and Appoints New Independent Director
News.Summary: Jai Corp Limited's Board of Directors declared a special interim dividend of Rs. 5.00 per share on 17,55,04,995 fully paid-up equity shares for financial year 2025-26, payable to shareholders on record date August 1, 2025. The company also recommended a final dividend of Re. 0.50 per share for financial year 2024-25. The board appointed Mr. Amit K. Mundra as an additional non-executive independent director for five years, subject to shareholder approval. Mundra was also appointed as a member of the Nomination and Remuneration Committee. Additionally, the board recommended re-appointment of Chairman Mr. Anand Jain, who retires by rotation at the upcoming 40th Annual General Meeting. The company noted a fine imposed by BSE Limited during the meeting.

News.Title: Jai Corp Reports Q4 Financial Results
News.Summary: Jai Corp has released its Q4 financial results. The company's EBITDA for Q4 was 102 million rupees, down from 170.6 million rupees in the same quarter last year. The EBITDA margin decreased to 7.55% from 13.9% year-over-year. The consolidated net profit for Q4 was 233 million rupees, slightly down from 234.2 million rupees year-over-year, but up from 124 million rupees quarter-over-quarter. Q4 revenue increased to 1.35 billion rupees from 1.23 billion rupees in the same quarter last year.

News.Title: Jai Corp Receives Rs. 362.72 Crore from Urban Infrastructure Pvt Ltd
News.Summary: Jai Corp has announced the receipt of Rs. 362.72 crore, net of tax deducted at source, from Urban Infrastructure Pvt Ltd (UIHPL). This payment is related to the capital reduction of UIHPL.

News.Title: Jai Corp Receives Rs. 362.72 Crore from Urban Infrastructure Pvt Ltd
News.Summary: Jai Corp has received Rs. 362.72 crore (net of tax deducted at source) from Urban Infrastructure Pvt Ltd (UIHPL) as a result of UIHPL's capital reduction.

News.Title: Jai Corp: CBI Files Rs 2,434 Crore Fraud Case Against Company and Director
News.Summary: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) has filed a fraud case against Jai Corp, its director Anand Jain, and others for allegedly defrauding public investors of Rs 2,434 crore in real estate projects. The case was filed following an order from the Bombay High Court. Other accused include Urban Infrastructure Venture Capital, Urban Infrastructure Trustees Ltd., and various directors, promoters, shell companies, and trusts associated with Jai Corp.

News.Title: Jai Corp Director and Associates Accused of Investor Fraud
News.Summary: Anand Jain, a director of Jai Corp, along with Urban Infrastructure Venture Capital, Urban Infrastructure Trustees Ltd, and others, have been accused of defrauding investors of approximately 2,434 crore rupees. This allegation represents a significant corporate governance issue for the company.

News.Title: CBI Registers Case Against Jai Corp
News.Summary: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) has registered a case against Jai Corp. No further details about the nature of the case or the allegations are provided in the given news snippet.

News.Title: Jai Corp Reports Q3 FY24 Financial Results
News.Summary: Jai Corp has announced its Q3 financial results. The company's consolidated net profit increased to 124 million rupees, up from 119 million rupees year-over-year. Sequentially, it decreased from 171 million rupees in the previous quarter. Revenue for Q3 grew to 1.26 billion rupees, compared to 1.07 billion rupees in the same quarter last year.

News.Title: Jai Corp Reports Mixed Q3 Financial Results
News.Summary: Jai Corp has reported its Q3 financial results. The company's EBITDA increased to 124 million rupees from 119 million rupees year-over-year. However, the EBITDA margin decreased to 9.81% from 11.15% compared to the same period last year.

News.Title: Jai Corp Reports Increase in Q3 FY24 Net Profit and Revenue
News.Summary: Jai Corp has announced its financial results for the third quarter of the fiscal year. The company's consolidated net profit increased to 124 million rupees, up from 119 million rupees year-over-year. Sequentially, it decreased from 171 million rupees in the previous quarter. Revenue for Q3 rose to 1.26 billion rupees, compared to 1.07 billion rupees in the same period last year.

News.Title: Jai Corp: Shares Plummet 20% on Subsidiary's Capital Reduction Proposal
News.Summary: Jai Corp shares hit 20% lower circuit, reaching 52-week low of ₹247.90. The decline follows announcement of capital reduction proposal by subsidiary Urban Infrastructure Holdings Pvt. Ltd. (UIHPL). Jai Corp expects to receive ₹364 crore from the transaction, subject to approvals.

News.Title: Jai Corp to Receive 3.64 Billion Rupees from Urban Infrastructure Holdings' Capital Reduction
News.Summary: Jai Corp has received a notice from Urban Infrastructure Holdings Private Limited (UIHPL) regarding a capital reduction. As a result of this corporate action, Jai Corp is set to receive 3.64 billion rupees from UIHPL.

News.Title: Successful Flight Test at Navi Mumbai International Airport
News.Summary: Jai Corp reported a successful commercial flight validation test at the Navi Mumbai International Airport. This marks a significant milestone in the airport's development and readiness for operations.

News.Title: Jai Corp: PAPI System Testing Completed at Navi Mumbai International Airport
News.Summary: Jai Corp has announced that the Precision Approach Path Indicator (PAPI) system testing has been successfully completed at the Navi Mumbai International Airport. This marks a significant milestone in the airport's development process, indicating progress towards its operational readiness.

News.Title: Jai Corp Reports Improved Q2 EBITDA and Margin
News.Summary: Jai Corp has announced its Q2 financial results. The company's EBITDA increased to 164 million rupees from 134 million rupees year-over-year. Additionally, the EBITDA margin improved to 12.14% from 11.34% compared to the same period last year.

News.Title: Jai Corp Reports Increased Q2 Profits and Revenue
News.Summary: Jai Corp has announced its Q2 financial results, showing significant year-over-year and quarter-over-quarter improvements. The company's consolidated net profit rose to 172 million rupees, up from 116 million rupees in the same quarter last year and 137 million rupees in the previous quarter. Revenue also increased to 1.35 billion rupees from 1.18 billion rupees year-over-year.
